In experiments, nauplii of P. forbesi tolerated salinities at least as high as 14 PSU, and adults, at least 8 PSU. but it has become rare at salinities above 2 PSU, probably because of predation by A. sinensis and by Corbula amurensis.
based on field data; "but ~6.2 is a more common limit" (Orsi et al. 1983).
